mobs.long_desc: A northern roc sails above the mountain path.
mobs.desc: This bird resembles a twenty foot eagle; its massive brown wings stretch out on either side to catch the wind and support its bulky weight.  Two streaks of white feathers run down each side of his face and converge along the back, marking him as a male of the northern species.  This roc's mighty talons are powerful enough to shred armor, and his impressive lifting ability allows him to fly with even a horse within his mighty grasp.  He guards his nest with a cold viciousness, letting no one pass.

mobs.long_desc: A giant northern roc flies across the path.
mobs.desc: &0The plain brown of this giant roc marks her as a female.  She appears to be about thirty feet across, even larger then most males.  Her vicious claws and hooked beak are twice as long, allowing her to hunt better then her mate.  It is known throughout the realms that a female roc is a dangerous animal to cross, especially if she has hatchlings nearby.

mobs.long_desc: A roc hatchling snaps in the air, searching for food.
mobs.desc: &0Though just a baby, this hatchling is far from harmless. It stands about the size of a human male, perhaps six feet tall. Armed with a hooked beak and claws to match, it can put up quite a fight for its age. The hatchling squawks in hunger, as it peers around with big black eyes searching for any sign of its parents.

mobs.long_desc: A roc hatchling squawks loudly for its parents.
mobs.desc: Though just a baby, this hatchling is far from harmless.  It stands about the size of a human male, perhaps six feet tall.  Armed with a hooked beak and claws to match, it can put up quite a fight for its age.  The hatchling squawks in hunger as it peers around with big black eyes searching for any sign of its parents.

mobs.long_desc: The stone statue of a humanoid stands against the northern wall.
mobs.desc: A statue of a a humanoid rests against the wall here.  Its face is blank and the smooth gray stone is polished to perfection.  From the build, it appears to be male.  It stands a bit over six feet tall and must weight at least seven hundred pounds.

mobs.long_desc: A bulbous forest spider scurries across the ground.
mobs.desc: &0This dark green spider is about four feet across, its thin legs poking out at eight odd angles.  Vicious fangs drip with some unknown venom, as the spider glares around with its round eyes.  Its abdomen is three times the size of its upper body, containing all of its internal organs and life fluids.

mobs.long_desc: A giant canopy spider stands watch over his lair.
mobs.desc: &0Unlike most spiders, this canopy spider belongs to a sophisticated colony similiar to the ant.  He is about five feet long with slender legs designed to grasp on bark and flimsy branches with ease.  This one has the markings of a warrior, three vertical brown bars along its back.

mobs.long_desc: A giant canopy spider darts through the branches, dragging along its prey.
mobs.desc: &0This canopy spider is about five feet long, and is armed with a pair of vicious fangs.  His multi-sided eyes gleam with cunning, as he darts through the canopy dragging a quivering cocoon behind.  The brown markings along the spider's back marks him as a hunter.

mobs.long_desc: A monstrous canopy spider glares about her domain.
mobs.desc: &0This gigantic canopy spider is over twice the size of her brethren, perhaps ten feet long.  Her abdomen is the size of a small horse, and is marked with an exotic design of brown and emerald lines.  She is armed with a pair of vicious mandibles, each similiar to a serrated scimitar.  She is the head of this colony, the sole female in sight.

mobs.long_desc: A camouflaged hunter spider stalks his prey through the forest.
mobs.desc: &0This vicious spider is covered with a mottled design of different greens, creating a perfect camouflage affect in thick forests.  He is about four feet long, but his thin legs are designed to move through the underbrush with little noise.  &0

mobs.long_desc: A vicious tree spider darts through the forest, checking her webs.
mobs.desc: &0This breed of spider has an odd way of hunting.  It sets out several separate webs throughout its territory, darting between them to check for prey.  She is dark green in color, covered with thousands of bristle-like hairs which allow her to move through webs without any problems.  The spider is about six feet long, but is very slender allowing her to leap from tree to tree without disturbing a leaf.

mobs.long_desc: The dark patriarch of the cult stands here, tossing meat into the flames.
mobs.desc: A cloaked figure perhaps six feet tall, most of his facial features are bathed in shadows created by his deep hood.  From what is visible, it's obvious this man is half-orc.  A pig-like snout and enlarged fangs reveal his true heritage, along with the foul stench and gutteral speech.  A master amongst his people, this patriarch is the leader of the whole cult, a position that comes with a great deal of power and influence.

mobs.long_desc: A robed cultist stands within the tunnel, guarding it from intrusion.
mobs.desc: This young man is wrapped in a thick black cloak, hiding his true identity from all but his brethren.  He stands proudly at the cavern entrance, guarding it from infidels.  Armed with a curved black scimitar, he appears to be a skilled fighter.

mobs.long_desc: A robed cultist dances around the cavern, chanting in a hellish language.
mobs.desc: Dark flowing robes cover this woman, masking her true features from view.  She waves her hands through the air as she dances around the room, her body twisting and turning to the rythmatic chanting that spews from her vicious mouth.  Waves of ebony hair flow out from beneath her hood, hinting at her human or perhaps even elven heritage.

mobs.long_desc: Aldern stands here, watching over his store with a wary gaze.
mobs.desc: &0Aldern is a moderate sized man, dressed in simple wool clothing.  His sandy brown hair lies combed in place, its length just reaching down to his shoulders.  He has deep emerald eyes, like the darkest of forests.  Standing behind a counter, Aldern watches as people enter his establishment.

mobs.long_desc: An armored soldier watches the gate, carefully inspecting passers-by.
mobs.desc: &0Dressed in a fine suit of chainmail, this yound man looks prepared for battle.  He stands just under six feet tall, and is of average weight for a human.  His dark brown hair is pulled back into a simple pony tail, keeping it held securely in place.  A slender longsword hangs from his belt, its hilt wrapped tightly in leather.

mobs.long_desc: An armored soldier stands here, watching the gate intently.
mobs.desc: &0Dressed in a fine suit of chainmail, this yound man looks prepared for battle.  He stands just under six feet tall, and is of average weight for a human.  His dark brown hair is pulled back into a simple pony tail, keeping it held securely in place.  A slender longsword hangs from his belt, its hilt wrapped tightly in leather.

mobs.long_desc: A well-groomed horse stands in the stables, feeding on hay and grain.
mobs.desc: &0This well-built horse looks capable of withstanding the rugged badlands. Bred for rough terrain, his powerful muscles look quite relaxed, feeding upon the sweet grains offered in the stables.

mobs.long_desc: Naleen Moonwalker stands behind the bar, tending to customers.
mobs.desc: &0The slightly pointed ears and soft angular facial features immediately reveals this woman's half-elven heritage.  Her flowing blonde hair lies tied in a thick braid that reaches almost to her waist, its golden length combed neatly and surprisngly clean considering her working enviroment.  The grace in Naleen's step however reveals much more then her physical appearance.  She holds herself like a warrior, possessing deft agility and coordination.

mobs.long_desc: A well-armed border soldier stands here, eyes open for danger.
mobs.desc: This young man appears to be in his late twenties, having spent most of his adult life training to be a warrior.  He is of moderate size for a human, and has been outfitted with a longsword and a suit of chainmail.  A dark cloak of leather drapes over his body, warding off the cold when needed and offering some camouflage against an attacker's arrow.

mobs.long_desc: The captain of the guard stands here, keeping the area secure.
mobs.desc: &0This man appears to be about thirty years old, his weathered face showing the first signs of wrinkles.  He is still powerfully built however, a warrior far from decline.  He is dressed in a loose crimson tunic, draped over his shirt of chainmail.  A golden crown is just barely visible on the tunic's front, half covered by his dark flowing cloak.  A sword hangs at his belt, ready to be drawn at the first sign of danger.

mobs.long_desc: Lord Venth sits here, going over several old maps.
mobs.desc: &0This elderly man looks to be in his early fifties, though by his powerful stature and clear eyes it's obvious he hasn't lost the fighting edge that earned him the title of Lord in Solta's army.  Assigned to manage the northern borderhold, Lord Venth has spent the last few years within this walled village.

mobs.long_desc: A soldier snores softly, tucked into his bunk.
mobs.desc: &0This soldier must have just recently gotten off shift.  He lies fully clothed in his bunk, sound asleep.  A low snore escapes his beard-covered face, as he dreams of something far more pleasant then the borderhold he is stationed in. He must be in his early twenties, and by the depth of his sleep he might not yet be used to the hard soldier life.

mobs.long_desc: A wary adventurer wanders about the borderhold.
mobs.desc: &0This well-built human appears to be a fighter of some type.  He is dressed in a suit of ringmail, and has a wooden shield straped to his back.  A cloak of brown blankets most of his body, its leathery surface marked with over a week's worth of mud and dirt.  The grim faced adventurer keeps glancing from side to side, keeping an eye out for danger.

mobs.long_desc: A drunken dwarf stands here, telling a tale of his adventures.
mobs.desc: &0This dark haired dwarf is dressed in a rough woolen tunic, gray in color. His armor must have been discarded in favor of lighter clothing.  A hand axe hangs at his side, lying forgotten as the dwarf spins a tale of orc slaying in the nearby badlands.  His breath reeks of ale, and by his slurred speech it is obvious he has drunk several barrels of ale by himself.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarven warrior slumps here, downing a tankard of ale.
mobs.desc: &0Part of a band of dwarven warriors, this experienced adventurer leans back in his chair and listens to his friend recount their latest journey.  He is dressed in a well crafted tunic of ringmail, most likely dwarven in origin.  A pot helm sits nearby on the table, currently unused.

mobs.long_desc: An elven maiden slips through town, obviously trying to hide something.
mobs.desc: &0This elven maiden looks oddly out of place.  She is dressed in a forest green cloak that covers most of her body, leaving little of the leather tunic and breeches visible underneath.  Her soft blonde hair only just spills out from beneath her hood, leaving little in sight.  Her soft angular features and the tiny hint of pointed ears from beneath her hair give away her true nature, but reveal nothing of what she is doing here.

mobs.long_desc: A plant elemental blends with the surrounding underbrush.
mobs.desc: A mass of animated vegetation, it stands perhaps six feet tall, with half a dozen writhing vines leaping out from its body in random directions.  Created by the druids and given conciousness by the Earthmother, this guardian of nature would do anything to ensure the vale's safty.

mobs.long_desc: An ancient oak tree stands guard over the forest.
mobs.desc: At first glance, this tree seems much like the others in the area: tall, heathy, and quite stationary.  Upon closer inspection, a sort of face is visible within its bark.  It is a kindly face, wrinkled with the passing of time.  Its limbs seem more like arms, its leaves like hair.  This tree is really a treant, one of the guardians of the forests and a stout ally of the druid council.

mobs.long_desc: The high druid stands here, contemplating some mystery.
mobs.desc: &0Head of the druid council, Loken the high druid has served the Earthmother for all of his life. His wrinkled face doesn't even come close to revealing his true age of several centuries, having had his lifespan increased by nature a dozen times. Currently, Loken stands amidst his brothers, seeking new recruits and sitting council with old members.

mobs.long_desc: An elder druid passes through the vale, tending to its growth.
mobs.desc: &0This elderly human appears to be in his early fifties. He is dressed in a long flowing robe, which is cinched around his waist by a simple rope belt. A bit of a beard has begun to grow on his tanned face, the color of new snow. He is at home in the wild, stepping through plant life without cracking a twig.

mobs.long_desc: A silent dryad stands guard over the forest.
mobs.desc: This silent creature stands here, like a tree amongst the surrounding forest. Her skin is like soft bark, subtle yet surprisingly resistant.  Her soft hair flows down like leaves from her head, deep emerald like the color of her emotionless eyes.  Spurred on by some unknown force, this dryad protects these forests with unparraled wrath.  None, not even druids, are welcomed.

mobs.long_desc: A dryad darts through the trees, making no sound.
mobs.desc: A beautiful creature that is one with nature, the dryad is formed like a young woman.  She moves like a deer, making not a sound as her lithe body slips between tunk and bush with equal ease.  Akin to a tree spirit, this young dryad has sworn to protect this forest from all invaders, even if their intentions may be noble.

mobs.long_desc: An ancient dryad stands here, communing with nature.
mobs.desc: &0The ancient bark-like skin of this magnificant dryad is wrinkled and rough, like the surface of the oldest oak. Her long green hair lies rolling down her shoulders, reaching well past her waist. A loose fitting green robe hangs from her slender form, worn only for its appearance.&0

mobs.long_desc: A wrinkled dryad stands watch over her tree.
mobs.desc: This ancient dryad has withdrawn into the forest's heart, staying near to the tree she is bonded with.  She is dressed in a translucent gown of pale green cloth, draping over her wrinkled body like mist.  Even though her eyes show a calm wisdom, the dryad's oath to defnd this forest will drive her to attack even a fellow druid.

mobs.long_desc: An elder dryad peers out from behind some foliage.
mobs.desc: &0Sworn to protect these forests from all intruders without mercy, this elder dryad has spent most of her life slaying unknowing wanderers. In her old age, she has withdrawn from the outer forest to visit her birth tree. Her skin is bark-like, rough and pale brown in color. The dryad's eyes are deep emerald in color, similiar to the long flowing hair that drapes down her slender back.

mobs.long_desc: A water sprite floats through the crystal waters, guarding her lake.
mobs.desc: &0This little creature is barely three feet high. Her slender form is elf-like, down to her pointed minature ears. A pair of insect feelers jut out from her forehead, similiar to that of a butterfly. Glossy semi-translucent wings push her light body through the water, as she swims from one side of the lake to the other enjoying the enviroment. Even though not evil, a water sprite will do anything to protect her lake from harm.&0

mobs.long_desc: A forest sprite darts through the trees on a pair of wings.
mobs.desc: &0This little creature is barely two feet tall, with the build of an elven maiden.  Her pale skin is the color of leaves, a mixture of greens that match her solid emerald eyes and billowing hair.  A pair of antennae stick up from her forehead, in a manner similiar to insects.  She is armed with a pair of translucent wings and powerful magic, devoting her whole life to defending these woods from outsiders, be they friendly or not.

mobs.long_desc: A slender druid stands watch over this sacred grove.
mobs.desc: &0This half-elf appears to be in his prime, with his dark blonde hair still lacking even the touch of gray. His pointed ears stick up from beneath these golden waves, giving him a more elven the human appearance. This however is quickly dispelled by his stubby beard, which although not very full is quite distinct. He stands in a robe of flowing green cloth, watching over these holy stones with his life.

mobs.long_desc: A soldier chews some beige mush quite unenthusiastically.
mobs.desc: Well-built and athletic in appearance, this young man has spent much of his adult life training as a soldier.  Dressed in a light tunic and breeches, he is obviously not on duty.  He chomps on some unsavory-looking food, looking only moderately happy to be having a meal.

mobs.long_desc: A weatherbeaten man paces forward along the road.
mobs.desc: He looks like he hasn't had a bath in days.  Hefting a pack full of merchandise, he constantly scans back and forth for signs of bandits.  Mud covers his lower legs, as though he had been walking in a rainstorm recently. Still, he looks like he could take care of himself in a fight if he had to.

mobs.long_desc: A muscular mercenary hunts for work here.
mobs.desc: This scowling man looks like one of the locals who is often hired to provide a little deterring force to a merchant caravan in hopes of avoiding conflict with the bandit gangs that roam South Caelia.  Though he does not currently have a caravan to guard, his weapons are sharp and his armor has the shine of care.

mobs.long_desc: A druid on a pilgrimage travels the roads.
mobs.desc: She has the delicate look of one with elven blood, though her round eyes speak of a mixed heritage.  Long, chestnut brown hair is braided back to keep it out of her face in the windy environment of South Caelia.  Her simple robes and familiarity with the wildlife of the region mark her as a druid.

mobs.long_desc: A spotted rabbit nearly blends in with the surroundings.
mobs.desc: A small brown rabbit with white spots, this speckled little bunny is a hardy inhabitant of South Caelia, feasting on the grasses that thrive in the chill, temperate climate.  Its fur is thick and warm, and popular in some areas as a lining on jackets and muffs.  Its ears twitch ever so slightly, listening for danger.

mobs.long_desc: A strange-looking figure watches you suspiciously.
mobs.desc: Heavily cloaked in the chill air, this figure's yellow eyes are visible though its hood is pulled up.  Its frame is large, either muscular or fat, and the clothes are a style that isn't often seen around this area.  Moreover, the figure isn't carrying merchant goods nor does it have the look of a druidic pilgrim.  What is it doing here...?

mobs.keywords: antelope plains pronged-horns pronghorn pains-antelope creature dashing
mobs.long_desc: A creature with pronged horns dashes across the plains.
mobs.desc: Tan on the back, legs, and head and creamy white on his underbelly, the antelope has dark, vicious-looking brown horns and moves very swiftly.  It grazes on the abundant grasses and is the subject of hunts for both its venison-like meat and its impressive horns.

mobs.long_desc: A pudgy border soldier walks around, looking slightly suspicious.
mobs.desc: Unlike any of the other border soldiers within the keep, this particular one is dressed in a hooded cloak, covering his features, with the usual suit of chainmail draped upon it.  He is rather pudgy, his belly bulging out a little against the chainmail.  A slender longsword hangs from his belt, and he grips its hilt tightly, his sallow, rather yellowish skin showing beneath his sleeves.

mobs.long_desc: A skinny young boy stands here, grooming the horses.
mobs.desc: Dusty-haired and skinny, this young boy is dressed in dirtied garb, tending the horses in the stables.  He doesn't look particularly happy to be here, but the work doesn't seem to bother him too much.

objects.ground: A pale blue stone lies here, its smooth surface etched with runes.

extras.text: This oblong stone is about a foot and a half long.  It is smooth to the touch, with no obvious edge.  The surface is colored a sparkling range of cyans, from light to dark.  Rings of deep purple runes run around it in two different sets. It is rumored that when used properly, the truthstone can reveal hidden knowledge to the user.

objects.ground: An oak chest sits upon a raised dais.

extras.text: The chest is about six feet across, crafted from a silvery metal.  Swirling designs cover the whole surface, creating a random pattern so complex that it is easy to be lost within it.  A platinum plaque is attatched to the chest's cover.  Several words are written on the plaque in a mystical language that all can understand: Within this box is an object of great power.  Its might can reveal the untold knowledge of all time.  It can instill purpose to those who are lost, and meaning to those who are without.  However, remember this:  The truth is subjective.

objects.ground: A small bronze key lies here.

extras.text: &0Strange ruins line this ancient silver key, their cryptic meaning lost thousands of years ago.  A sort of religious symbol has been etched upon its surface, though from what deity it is uncertain.  &0

objects.ground: An old cocoon, large and sticky, lies here.

extras.text: &0This cocoon is about five and a half feet tall, just large enough to contain a humanoid.  Deep within the white webbing, the shriveled form of a human can be seen.  Its eyes are sunken deep within its withered gray face.

objects.ground: A black book, bound in leather, rests here.

extras.text: The open page of the book reads: Those who follow the fallen gods are blessed with hellish powers beyond comprehension.  Darkness and chaos will one day sweep across the realms, and those few who are truly devoted to the unholy gods will be raised as lords over the land.  Devotion must be proved, however.  Only someone mighty enough to claim the ancient truthstone and present it unto the leader of chaos may be given the dark powers of hell.  These diabolists will be rewarded for their unquenchable devotion by the dark gods themselves!

objects.ground: A wide stone well rests in the center of the dirt clearing.

extras.text: Buried deeply in the ground, the stone well taps one of the cool underground rivers burrowing through the Wailing Mountains.  Although a faint metallic taste taints the water, it is drinkable and residents of the borderhold seem to have become accustomed to its flavor.

objects.ground: A rolled-up parchment lies here, neatly bound with red silk ribbon.

extras.text: &0This neatly rolled parchment looks quite new, perhaps two weeks old at the most.  Its crisp white paper is nicely kept, as is the swirling blue text that has been scrawled along its surface: Do not worry, Lord Gundbard.  The key is safe with me.  I apologize for abandoning my post, but rumors were abound of trouble near Fangron Forest.  My oath bound me to protect the innocent, so I must leave immediately to offer my aid.  I should be back within a week's time. Sir Gloris Whiteblade, Holy Templar

objects.ground: A broadsword with an alabaster pommel lies here.

extras.text: This large weapon is a two-handed sword with a very long blade made of steel with very little in the way of sharp edges, since it's meant for brute hacking. The hilt is made of bronze, with bronze crossguards and little ornamentation or decoration.  The pommel is weighted perfectly with a smooth white alabaster stone, opaque and milky-white.  There is no sign of what the stone signifies.

objects.short: a chunk of dried deer meat
objects.ground: A well-wrapped piece of meat sits here.

extras.text: It's a large piece of salty, hard-as-a-rock preserved meat.

objects.ground: A coil of rope lies here.

extras.text: It is a plain coil of hemp rope, about 50' long.

objects.ground: A deer-hide canoe lies here.

extras.text: It is a simple one-man canoe made of pale deerhide, tanned and scraped clean of fur. The stitching is quite waterproof.

objects.ground: A brass lantern sits here.

extras.text: Made of beaten brass, this hooded lantern features a handle for easy carrying.

objects.ground: A simple waterskin sits here.

extras.text: It's made of leather, and looks vaguely like a pouch, with a spout for drinking from.

objects.ground: A leather traveling pack sits here.

extras.text: Looking quite a bit larger than the average belt pouch, this traveling pack has straps so that it can be worn like a backpack as well as handles to that it can be held.  Made of fine tanned leather, it looks quite sturdy and should alst a long time in the hands of a careful owner.

objects.ground: A leather bracer studded with iron lies here.

extras.text: It covers the forearm from just past the elbow to just short of the wrist, in dark leather studded all over with iron armoring-studs.  It straps on along the underside of the wrist.

objects.ground: A yellow shield bossed in silver lies here.

extras.text: The shield is round, with good, sturdy handles on its back for gripping it and keeping it close to the body for defense.  It is made of steel overlaid on wood, and the steel is bossed in silver, and shined to a high sheen.  The design of a lion is etched into the center of the shield, a quick but detailed job.

objects.ground: A vest of fine ringmail lies here.

extras.text: High quality manufacture has produced this vest of fine ringmail.  The rings look to be made of wrought iron, so they won't rust easily.  The rings are sewn onto a base armor of thick leather.

objects.ground: &0&3A wooden key covered with leaves, lies here.&0

extras.text: It is a simple key made of wood dyed green and carved with a design of oak leaves.

objects.ground: &0&3A wooden key covered with leaves lies here.&0

extras.text: It's a simple key made of wood dyed red and carved with designs of maple leaves.

objects.ground: &0&3A wooden key covered with leaves lies here.&0

extras.text: It's a simple wooden key dyed yellow and carved with designs of yew leaves.

objects.ground: A pendant on a silver chain lies here.

extras.text: This pale, clear blue stone is set in silver, on a thin filigree silver chain. It sparkles in any light.

objects.ground: A stone monolith stands under some massive oak trees.

extras.text: This ancient stone monolith appears to have stood here for centuries, withstanding the years of weathering and other adverse conditions. A blanket of bright green vines wind their way up its length, prospering from the nearby druidic magic. Several passages are visible on the monolith: The monoliths of the south were built in the Whitewood Forest, far south of the Wailing Mountains. These proud stones were construced by the first followers of nature, the father druids. When first erected, they were a testimony to the druidic faith, standing unharmed even throughout the barbarian wars.

objects.ground: Deep within some bushes, a tall stone monolith is visible.

extras.text: This ancient stone monolith appears to have stood here for centuries, withstanding the years of weathering and other adverse conditions. A blanket of bright green vines wind their way up its length, prospering from the nearby druidic magic. Several passages are visible on the monolith: The monoliths of the north were built near the Wailing Mountains, providing the druids with a means of guarding those nearby lands from corruption. Its builders soon grew wary of this existance and wished to travel on to the next. In haste, they bargained with a clan of dryads. They were given the stones, in return for their endless vigil over them.

objects.ground: A stone monolith juts up from the ground, towering over many smaller trees.

extras.text: This ancient stone monolith appears to have stood here for centuries, withstanding the years of weathering and other adverse conditions. A blanket of bright green vines wind their way up its length, prospering from the nearby druidic magic. Several passages are visible on the monolith: The ancient monoliths of the east were built south of a great, icy lake. Father Ghelin and Me'neil were proud of these standing stones, erected with as much care as the previous four. Guarding the strange energies there, they are watched always by an member of the order, and provide the earth mother's children with a means of communication.

objects.ground: A slab of stone sits upon two squat pillars.

extras.text: This slab of stone must weigh several tons, being at least ten feet square and half a foot thick. It rests heavily upon two squat pillars, which stand about two feet from the grassy floor. Ancient text has been chisled into the slab's surface, written for all eternity in stone. The ancient children of the earth mother labored hard, creating a network of mystical standing stones, columns, and monoliths to better commune with nature. These powerful stones mark mystical spots of serenity, places where a follower of nature can speak with the earth mother and those spirits who follow her guidance. For this reason, an initiate of the faith must visit the four greatest of these creations, with there being in existance one each to the north, east, south, and west. At each, the phrase of devotion must be spoken, by one true of heart and mighty enough to pierce the veil of nature: 'I pray for a blessing from mother earth, creator of life and bringer of death'. Once all these blessing are collected and presented before the high druid, the young devotee will be richly rewarded.

objects.ground: An unfinished object is lying here.
An elven lightstone glares brightly here.

extras.text: Made of glittery opaque white stone dotted with flecks of gold, this stone can be made to glow with a mere thought.

objects.ground: A stone monolith is here, covered with clinging vines.

extras.text: This ancient stone monolith appears to have stood here for centuries, withstanding the years of weathering and other adverse conditions. A blanket of bright green vines wind their way up its length, prospering from the nearby druidic magic. Several passages are visible on the monolith: The monoliths of the west were built near the Mountains of Pain, within their foothills. The very first collection of standing stones, they were guarded by the druid council for thousands of years. Over time, an alliance with the sprites were formed for mutual protection. Devious as they are however, they soon drove out the few remaining druids and claimed the stones for themselves.

objects.ground: A wreath of bay leaves lies here.

extras.text: Made of fresh-smelling bay leaves, this wreath's branches twine around themselves.

objects.ground: &0&7&bA mystical sphere of translucent energy floats here.&0

extras.text: &7&bA shining ball of translucent energy, the blessing of the east is a sign of devotion to the powers of nature and can only be properly used by a druid who stands at the stone slab in the Vale of Anlun.  &0

objects.ground: &0&7&bA mystical sphere of translucent energy floats here.&0

extras.text: &7&bA shining ball of translucent energy, the blessing of the east is a sign of devotion to the powers of nature and can only be properly used by a druid who stands at the stone slab in the Vale of Anlun.  &0

objects.ground: &2A mystical sphere of translucent energy floats here.&0

extras.text: &2 A shining ball of translucent energy, the blessing of the east is a sign of devotion to the powers of nature and can only be properly used by a druid who stands at the stone slab in the Vale of Anlun.  &0

objects.ground: &2A mystical sphere of translucent energy floats here.&0

extras.text: &2A shining ball of translucent energy, the blessing of the east is a sign of devotion to the powers of nature and can only be properly used by a druid who stands at the stone slab in the Vale of Anlun.  &0

objects.ground: A long pitchfork burns the ground where it lies.

extras.text: Cast from a charred, blackened metallic substance, the trident is painfully hot to the touch, yet leaves no burns on skin.  It stands as tall as an average human, the three prongs on one end running about a quarter of its length.  At the tip of each prong, a wicked looking arrow looks sharp enough to rend stone.

objects.ground: A cloak of &2green&0 and &3brown&0 is sitting in a pile here.

extras.text: Made of delicate branches and leaves, this cloak looks ready to crumble at any moment, yet provides a magical benifit to its wearer due to the powers of nature tht made it.  Though someone wearing this cloak might be mistaken for a bush, they are used as a symbol of status and a mark of favor among many groups of druids.

objects.ground: A slender iron stick with teeth sits in the dust.

extras.text: It appears to be an old iron skeleton key, slightly rusted and worn on the teeth.  The word Toldar has been printed in tiny lettering along the shaft of the key.

objects.ground: A pile of stinky yellow powder has been gathered here.

extras.text: This fine powder reeks like rotten eggs!  Also called sulfur in some cultures, brimstone is closely associated with demons, the hells, fire, and divine retribution.  However, brimstone is also a critical ingredient in many alchemical formulas and is a powerful agent for change.

objects.ground: Someone has left a carved up lump of bloody raw meat here.

extras.text: This gruesome gob of meat is fresh and dripping with blood.  It seems to be a single one-pound chunk taken from a larger creature.  From the color, it doesn't seem to be from a common farm or game animal.  Maybe a pig?  Or...?

objects.ground: A flaming pitchfork stands impaled in the ground.

extras.text: Cast from a charred, blackened metallic substance, the trident is painfully hot to the touch, yet leaves no burns on skin.  It stands as tall as an average human, the three prongs on one end running about a quarter of its length.  At the tip of each prong, a wicked looking arrow looks sharp enough to rend stone.

objects.ground: A demonic trident wreathed in unholy flames scalds the air.

extras.text: Cast from a charred, blackened metallic substance, the trident is painfully hot to the touch, yet leaves no burns on skin.  It stands as tall as an average human, the three prongs on one end running about a quarter of its length.  At the tip of each prong, a wicked looking arrow looks sharp enough to rend stone.

objects.ground: A holy seal has been etched into the floor.

extras.text: &0A carefully etched seal covers most of this stone floor. Its circular pattern depicts several different symbols of many of the divine gods. Gold ink has been ground into the etchings, giving it a slight glittering effect.

triggers.name: statue guards chest
triggers.commands: if ((%arg% == chest) || (%arg% == oak)) return 1 mechoaround %actor% %self.name% steps between %actor.name% and the oak chest. msend %actor% %self.name% steps between you and the oak chest. say I am charged with the protection of this chest. say I cannot let you have its contents. else return 0 endif

triggers.name: patriarch receives truthstone
triggers.commands: * * original Smoldering Trident trigger * if (%object.vnum% == 2300) wait 1 set object_shortdesc %object.shortdesc% mjunk %object.name% wait 3 mechoaround %actor% %self.name% stops tossing meat into the fire and peers at %actor.name%. msend %actor% %self.name% stops tossing meat into the fire and looks at you. wait 3s if (%actor.class% == Diabolist) if (%actor.level% >= 35) smile say Excellent...very, very excellent. emote pockets %object_shortdesc%. wait 2s say He will be very happy with this. emote turns towards the fire and begins chanting in an arcane tongue. wait 3s emote chants, 'Olarag hroshi nofaraio...' wait 2s mecho The flames begin to &4fl&bare&0, licking the cavern roof above! wait 2s emote chants, 'Dala kenthu sarijko dennal...' wait 2s mecho The &9&bun&0&5ho&bly&0 &4fi&bre&0 continues to grow, nearly engulfing %self.name%! wait 2s emote chants, 'Yarak tilaru kenzo jing!' mecho As %self.name% completes %self.p% chant, the &4fla&bmes&0 suddenly contract into a ball. wait 3s mecho A &3chi&bll&2ing&0 voice croaks something in a language you do not understand. wait 2s mecho The ball of &4fl&bame&0 slowly begins to change shape, elongating and pulsating. mecho The &4fl&bames&0 take the shape of a &1scar&blet &3trident&0. wait 3s mecho The trident falls to the ground by the &9&bsmoldering &1emb&bers&0. wait 1s emote gets a smoldering trident. wait 1s say Yes, I believe you have proven yourself indeed. smile wait 2s say The weapon is for you. wait 1s if (%actor.sex% == Female) say Go forth and smite those who might stand against us, sister. elseif (%actor.sex% == Male) say Go forth and smite those who might stand against us, brother. else say Go forth and smite those who might stand against us. endif mload obj 2334 give smoldering-trident %actor.name% if !%actor.quest_stage[hell_trident]% quest start hell_trident %actor% endif wait 1s * * for Hellfire Trident * if %actor.level% >= 65 say Hell hungers for more and will reward you greatly if you feed it.  Attack with that trident 666 times and then seek out the Black Priestess, the left hand of Ruin Wormheart.  She will guide your offerings. else say Other forces of Hell will eventually take notice of you too now.  Seek out the left hand of Ruin Wormheart, the Black Priestess, after you have grown more.  She will be your emissary. msend %actor% &1Reach level 65 to continue this quest.&0 endif * * for Hellfire and Brimstone * if (%actor.level% > 56) && !%actor.quest_stage[hellfire_brimstone]% wait 2s say You seem to be quite powerful already.  Powerful enough in fact to handle the Fire of the Dark One. wait 2s say Would you like to learn to rain fire and brimstone down on your enemies? endif * * original Smoldering Trident trigger * else blink say Quite amazing that you were able to retrieve %object_shortdesc%. peer %actor.name% wait 2s say Unfortunately, I don't think the Dark One would want to see such a weakling.  Return here again when you are more powerful. endif else snicker %actor.name% say You are no diabolist!  You no more deserve this power than Mielikki herself! emote tosses %object_shortdesc% in the flames. wait 2s say Run along now, there is nothing more for you here. endif endif * * Hellfire and Brimstone continued * if %actor.quest_stage[hellfire_brimstone]% == 3 if %object.vnum% == 4318 || %object.vnum% == 5211 || %object.vnum% == 5212 || %object.vnum% == 17308 || %object.vnum% == 48110 || %object.vnum% == 53000 if %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:%object.vnum%]% return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 say I have no need for a second %get.obj_noadesc[%object.vnum%]%! else wait 2 quest variable hellfire_brimstone %actor.name% %object.vnum% 1 mecho %self.name% holds %object.shortdesc% in his gnarled fist. say You have done well %actor.name%. mjunk %object.name% endif wait 2 set item1 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:4318]% set item2 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:5211]% set item3 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:5212]% set item4 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:17308]% set item5 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:48110]% set item6 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:53000]% if %item1% && %item2% && %item3% && %item4% && %item5% && %item6% emote laughs with dark pleasure! say A fine set of tributes to the Dark One! wait 4s say Now behold as I set this cavern alight! wait 2s mecho &1&b%self.name% spreads the flaming tributes throughout the cavern.&0 mecho &1&bThe piles of brimstone burn hot and bright!&0 wait 3s mecho &1&bThe fires trace out lines on the cavern floor, forming a huge burning sigil.&0 wait 4s msend %actor% &1&bGazing into the burning sigil, you feel the words to a prayer to the Dark One forming in your soul.&0&_ msend %actor% You have learned the prayers for &1&bH&3e&1llf&3i&1re&0 &1and &bBr&3i&1mst&3o&1ne&0! quest complete hellfire_brimstone %actor.name% if !%actor.quest_variable[hell_trident:helltask4]% && %actor.quest_stage[hell_trident]% == 1 quest variable hell_trident %actor% helltask4 1 endif mskillset %actor% hellfire and brimstone else say Bring me the rest of the fiery tributes! endif else return 0 mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. wait 2 say I have no need for this! endif endif
