triggers.name: high-druid-random
triggers.commands: sigh wait 2s say If only the blessings hadn't been lost...

triggers.name: high-druid-blessings
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.class% /= Druid wait 1 nod wait 1s say Long ago, the founders of the Vale left gret stone monoliths in each of the four power points of nature. say There was one in each direction, and they were used to commune with the powers of nature. wait 2s say But the blessings of nature were lost, and we were forced to abandon the stones in order to protect our order. wait 2s say If you could prove yourself by bringing me the blessing of the south, perhaps you could be sent after the others as well. bow %actor.name% else mecho %self.name% smiles sadly at %actor.name%. say I am afraid you cannot help me, my child. say This is a concern for the druids. endif endif

triggers.name: high-druid-receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.class% /= Druid if %object.vnum% == 2331 smile %actor.name% set blessings 1 global blessings wait 2s mjunk blessing say I am grateful the monoliths are still serving their purpose. say Perhaps the one to the west still retains its blessing as well? wait 2s say Please bring that to me as well! sigh say I would go myself, but I cannot leave the Vale. elseif %object.vnum% == 2333 if %blessings% == 1 set blessings 2 global blessings mecho %self.name% closes his eyes and smiles. wait 2s mjunk blessing say This is heartening!  I do hope the sprites were not too much trouble. say They tricked us long ago and kept the powers of nature for themselves. wait 2s say Another power point is to the north.  Bring me that blessing and we shall be one step closer to restoring the stones. bow %actor.name% else say Why thank you.  But how did you know I wanted this? wait 2s mjunk blessing endif elseif %object.vnum% == 2332 if %blessings% == 2 mecho The ancient druid's eyes light up as he receives the blessing. set blessings 3 global blessings wait 2s mjunk blessing say At last, the restoration is almost complete! say The only one remaining is the blessing of the east. wait 2s say But be careful - it was placed far from the others. say Since many of the ancient roads are no more, you may have some difficulty finding it. else say Why thank you.  But this does me little good right now. wait 2s mjunk blessing endif elseif %object.vnum% == 2330 if %blessings% == 3 mecho %self.name% heaves a great sigh of relief as he places the blessings on the stone slab. set blessings 0 global blessings wait 1s mecho The &9&bstone slab&0 begins to &7&bglow brightly!&0 wait 2s mecho &2&bTendrils of power shoot out from the stone slab, lighting the vale!&0 mecho %self.name% smiles hapily as he watches Nature's power at work. wait 4s mecho The &2&bglow&0 begins to fade. wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% turns to you and bows. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% bows to %actor.name%. say Truly, you have performed a great service to the Druids of Anlun Vale. say Please, it is not much, but accept this s a token of my gratitude. wait 1s mecho %self.name% pulls something out of his robes. mload obj 2335 give gaia-cloak %actor.name% wait 1s say Truly, you have the makings of a great druid within you. say Never lose sight of that, and you shall prosper. else say Very interesting - but I cannot use that just now. wait 2s mjunk blessing else eye %actor.name% say And why should I need this? return 0 endif else return 0 say Thank you, but I do not need this. msend %actor% %self.name% returns the item to you. endif else say I am sorry, but I am only looking for help from a fellow druid. msend %actor% %self.name% gives %object.shortdesc% back to you. endif endif

triggers.name: hellfire_brimstone_patriarch_speech
triggers.commands: if %actor.class% /= Diabolist && %actor.level% > 56 && %actor.quest_stage[hellfire_brimstone]% == 0 quest start hellfire_brimstone %actor.name% wait 2 grin mecho %self.name% says, 'Then first, you must prove your dedication to the dark mecho &0gods.' wait 2s say I need more meat to stoke the sacrificial bonfire! wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Slaughter paladins at the Sacred Haven, bring back mecho &0their flesh, and &1&b[drop]&0 it on the fire.' wait 4s say Six pounds should keep the fire burning long enough. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'If you need guidance, ask me about your &7&b[spell progress]&0.' endif

triggers.name: hellfire_brimstone_meat_death
triggers.commands: set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 unset person while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[hellfire_brimstone]% == 1 set chance %random.10% if %chance% > 7 mload obj 2338 endif endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[hellfire_brimstone]% == 1 set chance %random.10% if %chance% > 7 mload obj 2338 endif endif

triggers.name: hellfire_brimstone_drop
triggers.commands: wait 1 if %actor.quest_stage[hellfire_brimstone]% == 1 if %object.vnum% == 2338 wecho The bonfire crackles and roars! wpurge %object% wait 1s wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% says, 'Ah, such a pleasing sacrifice.' eval meat %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:meat]% + 1 quest variable hellfire_brimstone %actor.name% meat %meat% if %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:meat]% >= 6 wait 1s wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% says, 'This should be enough.  The Dark One is paying&_attention now.' quest advance hellfire_brimstone %actor.name% quest variable hellfire_brimstone %actor.name% drop 0 wait 2s wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% says, 'The next step is collecting the very soil of Hell&_itself: brimstone.  Brimstone can be found in and around volcanoes.  The fiery&_spirits that dwell there should collect it naturally.' wait 5s wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% says, 'Six quantities of brimstone are necessary to make the&_proper diagram for summoning hellfire.  Bring them here and &1&b[drop]&0 them' else wait 2 wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% says, 'Bring some more.' endif endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[hellfire_brimstone]% == 2 if %object.vnum% == 2337 wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% draws out lines with the brimstone. wpurge %object% wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% flashes a wicked grin. wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% says, 'It will burn like the very bowels of Hell.' eval brimstone %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:brimstone]% + 1 quest variable hellfire_brimstone %actor.name% brimstone %brimstone% if %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:brimstone]% >= 6 wait 2s nod wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% says, 'The Dark One is pleased with your efforts.' quest advance hellfire_brimstone %actor.name% quest variable hellfire_brimstone %actor.name% drop 0 wait 2s wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% says, 'Finally, gather six different types of fiery tribute:' wecho - three colors of flame: wecho &0&9&b    black&0 from Chaos incarnate wecho &0&b    gray&0 from a devotee of neutrality wecho &0&7&b    white&0 from a beam of starlight wecho - a torch carried by an actress pretending to be a goddess wecho - a dagger carried by the volcano goddess wecho - a fiery sword wielded by a king in his throne room crypt wait 6s wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% says, 'Return with these six fires and by six given thrice,&_the spell shall be complete.' else wait 2 wecho %get.mob_shortdesc[2311]% says, 'Bring some more.' endif endif endif

triggers.name: hellfire_brimstone_fiery_death
triggers.commands: set room %self.room% set person %room.people% while %person% if %person.quest_stage[hellfire_brimstone]% set drop %person.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:drop]% set chance %random.10% if %chance% > 6 mload obj 2337 endif endif set person %person.next_in_room% done

triggers.name: hellfire_brimstone_status_checker
triggers.commands: set stage %actor.quest_stage[hellfire_brimstone]% set meat %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:meat]% set brimstone %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:brimstone]% set item1 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:4318]% set item2 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:5211]% set item3 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:5212]% set item4 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:17308]% set item5 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:48110]% set item6 %actor.quest_variable[hellfire_brimstone:53000]% wait 2 switch %stage% case 1 mecho %self.name% says, 'I need &1&bmeat&0 for the fire.' eval total (6 - %meat%) if %total% == 1 mecho Bring me &1&b%total%&0 more pound of flesh from the paladins at the Sacred Haven. else mecho Bring me &1&b%total%&0 more pounds of flesh from the paladins at the Sacred Haven. endif break case 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'I need &3&bbrimstone&0 to trace out the sigils.' mecho &0 eval total (6 - %brimstone%) if %total% == 1 mecho Bring me &3&b%total%&0 more quantity of brimstone from fiery spirits on the mecho &0volcanic island to the north. else mecho Bring &3&b%total%&0 more quantities of brimstone from fiery spirits on the mecho &0volcanic island to the north. endif break case 3 say You are to bring me fiery tributes to the Dark One. mecho &0 if %item1% || %item2% || %item3% || %item4% || %item5% || %item6% mecho You have already given me: if %item1% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[4318]% endif if %item2% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[5211]% endif if %item3% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[5212]% endif if %item4% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[17308]% endif if %item5% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[48110]% endif if %item6% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[53000]% endif endif mecho &0 mecho Now bring me: if !%item1% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[4318]%&0from an actress in Anduin.&0 endif if !%item2% mecho - &7&b%get.obj_shortdesc[5211]%&0 from a beam of starlight deep in mine.&0 endif if !%item3% mecho - &b%get.obj_shortdesc[5212]%&0 from a devotee of neutrality on a hill.&0 endif if !%item4% mecho - &9&b%get.obj_shortdesc[17308]% from Chaos incarnate.&0 endif if !%item5% mecho - &1&b%get.obj_shortdesc[48110]%&0 from the volcano goddess.&0 endif if !%item6% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[53000]%&0 from a king in a throne room crypt.&0 endif break default if %actor.has_completed[hellfire_brimstone]% say You have already earned the favor of the Dark One. endif done

triggers.name: hellfire_brimstone_patriarch_greet
triggers.commands: wait 2 set stage %actor.quest_stage[hellfire_brimstone]% switch %stage% case 1 mecho %self.name% says, 'Have you brought me more meat?  &6&b[Drop]&0 it here if you have.' break case 2 mecho %self.name% says, 'Have you found brimstone?  &6&b[Drop]&0 it here if you have.' break case 3 say Give me any appropriate tributes you have found. break default if %actor.level% > 57 && %actor.class% /= Diabolist say You seem to be quite powerful...  Powerful enough in fact to handle the Fire of the Dark One. wait 2s say Would you like to learn to rain fire and brimstone down on your enemies? endif done

triggers.name: Hell Trident speech trident upgrades
triggers.commands: wait 2 set hellstep %actor.quest_stage[hell_trident]% if %hellstep% == 1 set level 65 elseif %hellstep% == 2 set level 90 endif if %hellstep% switch %self.vnum% case 2311 switch %hellstage% case 1 set response stage2 break case 2 set response stage3 break default if %actor.has_completed[hell_trident]% set response complete endif done break case 6032 set step 1 set spell1 %actor.has_completed[hellfire_brimstone]% set spell2 %actor.has_completed[banish]% if !%actor.quest_variable[hell_trident:helltask6]% if %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% > 3 quest variable hell_trident %actor% helltask6 1 endif endif break case 12526 set step 2 set spell1 %actor.has_completed[resurrection_quest]% set spell2 %actor.has_completed[hell_gate]% done if %hellstage% == %phase% if !%actor.quest_variable[hell_trident:helltask5]% if %spell1% quest variable hell_trident %actor% helltask5 1 endif endif if !%actor.quest_variable[hell_trident:helltask4]% if %spell2% quest variable hell_trident %actor% helltask4 1 endif endif endif if %actor.quest_stage[hell_trident]% == %step% if %actor.level% >= %level% if !%actor.quest_variable[hell_trident:greet]% quest variable hell_trident %actor% greet 1 if %self.vnum% == 6032 msend %actor% In the hissed whisper of ecstatic fervor %self.name% says, 'Six thrice is the number of the greater demons.  Undertaking thus six and six, and six again, their interest can be piqued.' msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% - Attempting to land &3&bsix and six and six&0 in thrusts of your trident shall provide the pattern of the number. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% - &3&bSix rubies, all uncut in nature, does double the signature. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% - Slay &3&bsix beings called angels&0, be they of any make or countenance, the number being counted thrice. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% - Sup on the grand powers of Hell to learn the most esoteric diablery.  Complete the quests for &3&bBanish&0 and &3&bHellfire and Brimstone&0. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% - Assist the High Priestess of Lolth in hunting down and destroying the heretics of her Goddess. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'In undertaking six in all will Hell be at your beck and call.' elseif %self.vnum% == 12526 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Perhaps I will grant you a boon if you carry out sacrifices in my name.' msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% - &3&bAttack with %get.obj_shortdesc[2339]% 666 times&0 as a sacrifice of power. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% - Bring me &3&bsix radiant rubies&0 as a sacrifice of wealth. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% - Slay a combination of &3&bsix ghaeles, solars, or lesser seraphs&0.  Their suffering shall please me as a sacrifice of divinity. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% - Learn the most unholy of prayers.  Complete the quests for &3&bResurrection&0 and &3&bHell Gate&0 as a sacrifice of knowledge. msend %actor% &0 msend %actor% - Finally, find one long-buried and branded an infidel.  &3&bFinish his undying duel for him&0 as a sacrifice of honor. wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do this and I will lend you a greater share of my power.' endif wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You can ask about your &6&b[weapon progress]&0 at any time.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Remember your six sacrifices.  Ask about your &6&b[weapon progress]&0 if you must.' endif else set response level endif else if %actor.has_completed[hell_trident]% set response complete elseif %actor.quest_stage[hell_trident]% < %step% set response stage1 else set response stage3 endif endif if %response% == stage1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You must make the initial offerings with another dark priest.' elseif %response% == stage2 if %actor.level% >= %level% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Hell hungers for more and will reward you greatly if you feed it.  Attack with that trident 666 times and then seek out the Black Priestess, the left hand of Ruin Wormheart.  She will guide your offerings.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Other forces of Hell will eventually take notice of you too now.  Seek out the left hand of Ruin Wormheart, the Black Priestess, after you have grown more.  She will be your emissary.' msend %actor% &1You must be level %level% or greater to continue this quest.&0 endif elseif %response% == stage3 if %actor.level% >= %level% msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'The Demon Lord Krisenna is known to traffic with mortals from time to time.  Impress him and perhaps he will grant you a boon.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Continue to prove your value to Hell and perhaps a Demon Lord might be willing to grant your their patronage.' msend %actor% &1You must be level %level% or greater to continue this quest.&0 endif elseif %response% == complete msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You've already marshalled the forces of Hell and Damnation to your side!' elseif %response% == level msend %actor% %self.name% say, 'Stand before me again when you have achieved a larger measure of greatness.' msend %actor% &1You must be level %level% or greater to continue this quest.&0 endif endif

triggers.name: **UNUSED**
triggers.commands: * * for Creeping Doom * set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% unset person while %i% > 0 set person %actor.group_member[%i%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[creeping_doom]% == 2 || (%person.level% > 80 && (%person.vnum% >= 1000 && %person.vnum% <= 1038)) set rnd %random.50% if %rnd% <= %self.level% mload obj 61517 endif endif endif eval i %i% - 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[creeping_doom]% == 2 || (%person.level% > 80 && (%person.vnum% >= 1000 && %person.vnum% <= 1038)) set rnd %random.50% if %rnd% <= %self.level% mload obj 61517 endif endif * * Death trigger for random gem and armor drops * * set a random number to determine if a drop will * happen. * * boss setup - 55580 boss_27 * set bonus %random.100% set will_drop %random.100% * 4 pieces of armor per sub_phase in phase_2 set what_armor_drop %random.4% * 11 classes questing in phase_2 set what_gem_drop %random.11% * if %will_drop% <= 20 * drop nothing and bail halt endif if %will_drop% <= 60 * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 50 * drop a gem from the previous wear pos set eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55604 mload obj %gem_vnum% elseif (%bonus% >= 51 &%bonus% <= 90) * We're in the Normal drops from current wear pos set * drop a gem from the current wear pos set eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55615 mload obj %gem_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop a gem from the next wear pos set eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55626 mload obj %gem_vnum% endif elseif (%will_drop% >=61 &%will_drop% <= 80) * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 50 * drop destroyed armor 55299 is the vnum before the * first piece of armor. eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55331 mload obj %armor_vnum% elseif (%bonus% >= 51 &%bonus% <= 90) * We're in the Normal drops from current wear pos set * drop armor from the current wear pos set eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55335 mload obj %armor_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop a piece of armor from next wear pos eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55339 mload obj %armor_vnum% endif else * Normal non-bonus drops if %bonus% <= 50 * drop armor and gem from previous wear pos eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55604 eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55331 mload obj %gem_vnum% mload obj %armor_vnum% elseif (%bonus% >= 51 &%bonus% <= 90) * We're in the Normal drops from current wear pos set * drop a gem and armor from the current wear pos set eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55335 mload obj %armor_vnum% eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55615 mload obj %gem_vnum% else * We're in the BONUS ROUND!! * drop armor and gem from next wear pos eval gem_vnum %what_gem_drop% + 55626 mload obj %gem_vnum% eval armor_vnum %what_armor_drop% + 55639 mload obj %armor_vnum% endif endif

triggers.name: stablehand_list
triggers.commands: return 1 msend %actor% Available pets are: msend %actor% a steady warhorse - &340&0 c

triggers.name: stablehand_buy
triggers.commands: return 1 if %arg% == steady || %arg% == warhorse || %arg% == horse mteleport %actor% 3091 mat 3091 mforce %actor% buy warhorse mat 3091 mteleport %actor% 2348 mat 3091 mteleport warhorse 2348 mechoaround %actor% A steady warhorse starts following %actor.name%. else msend %actor% There is no such pet! endif

rooms.name: Path Near a Fortified Borderhold
rooms.description: The stout walls of a borderhold stand just to the north, their stony gray surfaces scarred with deep knicks and minor damage.  A fortified military outpost on the border along the Wailing Mountains and the northern caravan route, Toldar Keep stands in rigid defiance of marauding orc hordes.  A wide swath of open grassland has been cleared between the hold and the plains to the south, giving the keep's lookouts enough warning against southern incursions. A dirt road presents open access to the borderhold's gates to the north and winds into the plains.

rooms.name: Before the Borderhold's Southern Gates
rooms.description: Two huge iron gates swing inward on similarly massive hinges, barring and granting access to the military encampment within.  Each gate is heavily reinforced by wide steel braces, promising sturdy protection against battering rams.  The borderhold's high walls run outward from the gates, facing the plains to the south.

rooms.name: Within the Borderhold's South Gate
rooms.description: A large stone wall runs along to the south, its gray stone knicked and pitted from the elements and bands of mauraders about the borderlands. Interrupting the wall's continuous length, a tall iron gate swings inwards on strong reinforced steel hinges.  A well-traveled dirt path runs through the gate into the plains beyond, also continuing north into town.  Following the wall around the military encampment, another dusty path runs to the east and west from here.

rooms.name: Dirt Road Through the Borderhold
rooms.description: The wide dirt path continues north and south from here, connecting two of the borderhold's outer gates, allowing merchants and adventurers to travel through the keep easily.  A large rectangular building hulks just off the road to the east, its flat beige wall looking quite uninteresting.  Jolly laughter echoes out of a small tavern to the west.  A large gate is just to the south.

rooms.name: Dirt Road Through the Borderhold
rooms.description: Dust covers everything here, kicked up from the heavily-trodden dirt road running north-south through the center of the borderhold.  To the east, the wall of a large rectangular building has dust caked on it, and to the west dirt climbs the fence of a small stable.  Just north of here, a large stone well can be seen, and far beyond the Wailing Mountains can be seen hazily over the top of the borderhold's north wall.

rooms.name: Public Well in a Dirt Clearing
rooms.description: Most of the buildings in the encampment lie quite a number of paces away from this circular clearing, providing enough room for large congregations of people with minimal crowding.  The packed dirt paths running through the borderhold split here, encircling the wide stone well burrowed deep in the rocky ground.  Gates leaving the keep can be seen short distances away at the end of each dirt path branching from the well.

rooms.name: Dirt Road Through the Borderhold
rooms.description: Some small stone houses squat just to the east, crowding the wide dirt path between themselves and a large rectangular building to the west.  No entrances can be seen on the building from this vantage.  The dirt path continues north towards the borderhold's northern gate and south to the crossroads and public well.  Far beyond the keep's outer wall, the Wailing Mountains rise high above the mountain pass the borderhold is charged with guarding.

rooms.name: Dirt Road Through the Borderhold
rooms.description: The wide dirt path continues on its determined path north and south here, connecting the borderhold's north and south gates, allowing easy travel for merchants and adventurers passing through.  A large rectangular building sits ponderously to the west with no visible entrances on this side.  Just off the path to the east, the doors of a small cabin labeled Aldern's Adventuring Accoutrements stand open, ready for business.

rooms.name: Within the Borderhold's North Gate
rooms.description: Running north of the borderhold's buildings to the south, a heavy stone wall fortifies the keep along its outer perimeter.  A dirt path follows the inside of the wall, running east and west from here.  Another slightly wider dirt road runs south into the borderhold and north through the massive iron gate placed in the wall.  The gate looks aged and its iron has rusted in some parts, but steel braces and hinges reinforce, maintaining its strength.

rooms.name: Before the Borderhold's Northern Gates
rooms.description: The Wailing Mountains tower high just north of the borderhold, their rugged heights affording a degree of protection to the permanent military encampment. A pair of large reinforced iron gates further the keep's protection, each standing approximately fifteen feet high and lined with several bands of heavy steel.  The sturdy gray stone walls surrounding the borderhold are equally secure, stretching to either side of the gates.  Lookouts mounted atop the walls provide a clear view of the mountain pass to the north.  Although little more than a fortified outpost, it would take quite a force to conquer this town.

rooms.name: Path Near a Fortified Borderhold
rooms.description: Nearing the entrance of the rocky pass through the Wailing Mountains, the stout walls of a well-fortified keep stand just to the south.  Minor damage can be seen marring the walls even from here, reflecting the orc raids that have plagued the town.  The borderhold stands at the intersection of this path and the northern caravan route, securing the vicinity against incursions by marauding bands.  To the north, the Wailing Mountains begin their steep ascent, their peaks disappearing into the clouds.  An odd howling noise creeps out of the mountains.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Encircling the interior of the borderhold, the trampled dirt road runs just within the gray stone walls surrounding the keep.  The road continues to the east and west, following the ten-foot high northern wall.  Forlorn tufts of weeds grow at the edges of the dirt path, trying in vain to avoid the traffic around the borderhold.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Encircling the interior of the borderhold, the trampled dirt road runs just within the gray stone walls surrounding the keep.  The road continues to the east and west, following the ten-foot high northern wall.  Forlorn tufts of weeds grow at the edges of the dirt path, trying in vain to avoid the traffic around the borderhold.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Rising out of the gray stone wall that corners sharply here, a short lookout post watches over the Caravan Route running through the borderhold and the path into the Wailing Mountains.  The packed dirt road follows the walls, turning to the west and south here.

rooms.name: A Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: A trampled dirt path travels around the inside of the borderhold's outer wall, running north-south here.  The wall rises about ten feet high, built of a dark gray stone from the nearby Wailing Mountains.  Some minor damage has been sustained over the years, but it looks to have been easily repaired by skilled masons.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: A well traveled path leads around the outer wall of the borderhold, traveling north-south at this point.  Its length is continually patrolled by armed guards.  The wall itself is perhaps ten feet high, constructed of a dark gray stone, likely quarried from the nearby Wailing Mountains.  Parts of the wall are scarred by deep knicks, but none of them look particularly threatening.  The keep's east gate lies just to the south, and the flat beige outside wall of a militaristic house stands to the west.

rooms.name: Within the Borderhold's East Gate
rooms.description: Two dirt roads intersect here, the east-west path running directly through the borderhold and the perimeter trail crossing in front of a large iron gate that opens outwards.  The perimeter trail follows the borderhold's outer wall, heading north and south behind various buildings.  The iron gates are monstrous, reinforced by large bars of steel and hanging on large hinges.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Traveling between the borderhold's high stone wall to the east and a large rectangular building to the west, this heavily-trodden dirt path runs north-south here, following the borderhold's perimeter.  A large gate in the wall can be seen just to the north, and farther, above the top of the keep's north wall, the Wailing Mountains peek through the hazy clouds.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: A trampled dirt path runs around the inside of the borderhold's high fortified wall, continuing north and south here alongside a large rectangular building to the west.  No entrances to the building can be seen from this vantage.  Far to the north, the Wailing Mountains can be seen over the top of the north wall.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: The trampled dirt road makes a sharp turn here, running east and south from this point, dividing the high stone wall of the borderhold, constructed from a strong gray stone, and a large rectangular building to the northwest.  A short tower of the same stone as the wall stands atop the southeast corner of the wall, providing an excellent vantage of the caravan route and plains.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Running in between the high stone wall to the south and a large rectangular building to the north, the heavily-trodden dirt road runs east-west, following the borderhold's perimeter.  Minor patchwork can be detected on the inside of the walls, evidence of the warfare previously fought at this very spot. Although damaged, the walls have been fixed quite well, ready to repel another attack.

extras.text: Written in the stony patchwork are words carved by its mason: The Borderhold: now bigger, better, and more border-holding! -Laoris 2006

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Never failing to repel an attacker, the walls encircling the borderhold are quite strong, built high from a gray stone.  Following the wall east to west here, the dirt path divides the wall from a large rectangular building to the north.  A wooden door stands in the building's wall.  Just to the west, the borderhold's south gate lies in the wall, its heavy iron gates admitting adventurers and merchants alike.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: The dirt trail travels between the side of a wooden building to the north and the gray stone wall to the south.  Following the wall encircling the entire borderhold, the path runs east to west here.  Nearby to the east, large iron gates can be seen hanging on massive hinges.  Some small holes appear in the walls where battering rams have broken through, but most of them have been skillfully repaired with strong masonry.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: The trampled dirt road runs to the east and west from this point, dividing the high stone wall to the south from the buildings of the borderhold.  The wall is perhaps ten feet high, constructed of a dark gray stone.  It appears quite strong, though many years of abuse have left knicks and scars on its surface.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: A stout tower stands atop the gray stone wall circling the borderhold, allowing lookouts to watch for incursions from the plains to the south of the keep.  The packed dirt road turns a corner here, continuing north and east here.  The tips of the Wailing Mountains can be seen peeking through the clouds over the top of the borderhold's wall far to the north.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Well-traveled and dusty, a dirt road leads around the inside the outer wall of the borderhold, traveling north and south from this point.  About ten feet high, the wall itself is constructed of a dark gray stone, likely quarried from the nearby Wailing Mountains, which can be seen over the top of the keep's wall far to the north.  Parts of the wall are scarred by deep knicks, but none appear particularly threatening to the wall's stability.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Circling the interior of the borderhold's wall, a heavily-trodden dirt road runs just within the gray stone walls surrounding the keep.  The road continues north to the borderhold's west gate and south along the stone wall.  Little growths of grass grow at the edges of the road, trying in vain to avoid the traffic around the borderhold.

rooms.name: Within the Borderhold's West Gate
rooms.description: Running north and south, the borderhold's high stone wall is interrupted here with a large iron gate, heavily reinforced by shiny steel braces.  From here, a dirt path travels south along the wall and north behind a large rectangular building to the northeast.  Another trodden dirt road runs to the continues east into the town and west through the borderhold's gate.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Following the inside of the wall surrounding the borderhold, the well-traveled dirt road here continues to the north around a large rectangular building to the east and south to a large gate in the wall.  Some minor damage can be seen decorating the wall, but it has been long ago patched.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Constructed long ago, the gray stone wall to the west running alongside the dirt road has suffered some minor damage, also long ago patched up.  The wall appears as strong as the day it was built, standing defiant against the marauding hordes beyond the borderhold.  The road here is packed dirt, heavily trodden by many adventurers, merchants, and soldiers.  Just over the top of the wall to the north, the tips Wailing Mountains can be seen.  A huge rectangular building hulks to the east, running right up to the edge of the road.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Making a sharp turn here, the trampled dirt road runs to the east and south from this point, dividing the high stone wall of the borderhold from a large rectangular building to the southeast.  A stout tower looks out over the wall, providing sentinels with a clear view of the approach to the borderhold from the Wailing Mountains just north of here and the caravan route stretching to the west.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Likely constructed from stone quarried from the nearby Wailing Mountains in the north, the tall dark wall surrounding the entire borderhold has sustained heavy damage here.  Patchwork can be seen even on the interior of the wall, long since repaired by skilled masons.  The dirt path following the inside of the wall continues to the east and west here, sandwiched between the wall to the north and a large rectangular building to the south.

rooms.name: Trail Along the Borderhold's Perimeter
rooms.description: Nestled between a high gray stone wall to the north and a large rectangular building to the south, the dirt path here narrows, mainly providing passage to soldiers and guard details.  The path continues to the east, where the inside of the borderhold's northern gate stands, and to the west, following the inside of the keep's wall.

rooms.name: Aldern's Adventuring Accoutrements
rooms.description: This nicely built cabin-like structure is quite roomy, providing Aldern with more then enough room to display his goods.  Racks of various items hang from the walls, from lanterns and torches, to thick coils of rope.  Supplying the passing adventurers with needed equipment, Aldern's shop is well known throughout this territory for having fair prices and quality goods.

rooms.name: Tavern of the Fallen Star
rooms.description: A roaring fire blazes brightly in the stone hearth that built directly in the northern wall of this pleasant tavern.  Several tables surrounded by wooden chairs circle the fire, providing a warm and comfortable place for the patrons to relax.  Even way out in the borderlands, the tavern seems to have captured a bit of homliness.  A wide bar lines the western wall, displaying barrels of ale and bottles of wine secured in place waiting to be purchased.

rooms.name: Dirt Road Through the Borderhold
rooms.description: Wide and heavily-trodden, the dirt road continues east-west straight between two of the borderhold's gates, one of which is nearby to the west.  The path here runs up against a large rectangular building to the north, its militaristic exterior appearing quite unattractive.

rooms.name: Dirt Road Through the Borderhold
rooms.description: A huge rectangular building rises to the north, its militaristic walls dwarfing the short fence of the small stable just across the street. Flattened by many years of continual use, the dirt road passes through here, running between the east and west gates of the borderhold.  Just to the east, a large stone well can be seen.

rooms.name: Dirt Road through the Borderhold
rooms.description: Squat stone houses line the dirt path, providing mediocre housing to soldiers and travelers alike.  The road is rather plain, packed down by years of constant use.  It runs straight through the borderhold, connecting the east and west gates.  The tips of the rugged Wailing Mountains far to the north beyond the keep's walls can be seen over the roofs of the houses here.

rooms.name: Dirt Road through the Borderhold
rooms.description: Squat stone houses line the dirt path, providing mediocre housing to soldiers and travelers alike.  The road is rather plain, packed down by years of constant use.  It runs straight through the borderhold, connecting the east and west gates.  The tips of the rugged Wailing Mountains far to the north beyond the keep's walls can be seen over the roofs of the houses here.

rooms.name: Private Housing
rooms.description: &0 Simple militaristic furniture lies neatly placed within this room, maximizing the available space.  A set of chairs and matching wooden table lie off in the northern corner, each constructed with some measure of skill using high quality timber.  A plush chair provides the only other seat, having been pushed towards the east wall near the warm stone hearth that crackles with a low fire.  On the opposite side of the house is a wool bed, neatly made and waiting for attention.

rooms.name: Cramped Barracks
rooms.description: Several dozen bunks line the interior of this wide building, taking up nearly all of the available space.  Each is equipped with a pair of simple pillows, a pale white sheet, and a gray woolen blanket.  Several basins sit nearby each bed, providing a place for a quick wash.  Closets line the walls, containing hooks to hang unused armor and spare clothing.  The dormitory-style barracks continue to the south.  Wooden doors lie in the north and west walls.

rooms.name: An Officer's Quarters
rooms.description: Considerably more open than the cramped barracks to the east, this chamber is furnished with a relatively plain bed dressed in white sheets, a sturdy but thin desk, and a large raised washbasin armed with soap and razors.  Once painted a colorful yellow hue, the walls have become drab and worn, pitted gray stone peeking through in multiple places.

rooms.name: Cramped Barracks
rooms.description: Several dozen bunks line the interior of this wide building, taking up nearly all the available space.  Each is equipped with a pair of simple pillows, a pale white sheet, and a gray woolen blanket.  Metal basins sit nearby each bed, providing soldiers with a place to wash up.  Closets line the walls, containing hooks to hang unused armor and spare clothing.  The cramped barracks continue to the north, and a wooden door lies in the west wall.

rooms.name: The Mess Hall
rooms.description: Impossibly cramped and minimalistic, the hall contains several long wooden tables with plain wooden benches.  At the end of the hall farthest from the door, a taller table perpendicular to the others presents all sorts of dry, undercooked, and otherwise unsavory foods.  Behind the table, an arrangement of crates and boxes are stacked, each bearing the stamp of Solta, the keep's mother state.

rooms.name: Cramped Barracks
rooms.description: Dozens of wooden bunks form rows in this hall, their spartan beddings indicating the military purposes of this building.  Each empty bed is perfectly made and neat, stray armor and clothing hung up cleanly in the closets lining the walls.  A metal basin sits at the end of each set of bunks, providing soldiers a place to maintain their hygiene.  The rows of bunks continue to the east, and sturdy wooden doors lie in the north and south walls.

rooms.name: Cramped Barracks
rooms.description: Dozens of wooden bunks form rows in this hall, their spartan beddings indicating the military purposes of this building.  Each empty bed is perfectly made and neat, stray armor and clothing hung up cleanly in the closets lining the walls.  A metal basin sits at the end of each set of bunks, providing soldiers a place to maintain their hygiene.  The rows of bunks continue to the west, and a large wooden door sits in the north wall.

rooms.name: A Well-Stocked Armory
rooms.description: The borderhold is apparently quite well supplied by its mother state of Solta!  This armory holds hundreds of articles of war, ranging from iron longswords and strudy long bows to shirts of chainmail and visored steel helmets.  A long row of lances is attached to the north wall, hanging over a collection of odd-shaped pieces of armor.

rooms.name: The Campaign Room
rooms.description: Built from sturdy Rhell wood, a large oval table occupies the majority of this room.  Various maps and documents lie scattered across the surface of the table, showing images and details of the surrounding area.  A ring of soft, comfortable-looking chairs encircles the table.  On the west end of the room, a large black board hangs on the wall, myriad chalk diagrams scratched upon its face.

extras.text: The squares seem to represent the borderhold's enemies.  One is marked 'dryad's, while several others read 'orc'.

The chalk diagrams on the black board consist of several complicated diagrams. At the center of the board, a large circle with the words "Toldar Keep" has been drawn, with several arrows pointing outwards at squares.  A procession of triangles runs just above the large circle, and a thin line stretches out from either side of it.

rooms.name: A Sheltered Stable
rooms.description: A simple slanted roof, held up by two sturdy wooden beams, provides shelter from rain and other adverse weather conditions for this roomy stable.  Several bales of hay lie stacked along its edges, adding a bit of warmth and bedding for mounts stabled here.  A clean-looking water trough provides fresh drink, while a large supply of bags of oats rest by the south wall, ready to be fed to horses.  To the south, a small wooden door leads into the Tavern of the Fallen Star, while to the north and east a short wooden fence offers the only barrier between the stable and the passing dirt roads.

rooms.name: Vale of Anlun
rooms.description: Thick foilage leaps up from the fertile earth of this lush valley, creating a dark green blanket of life over the whole area.  Plants spanning a thousand different species flourish here, cared for by the mystical powers of the druids and their goddess.  Huge oaks spring up in every corner, throwing out their huge canopies of healthy leaves to blanket the sky.  Just off to the east, several strange monoliths are detectable through the plantlife.

rooms.name: An Arched Gateway Entwined With Roses
rooms.description: &0   The curved remains of an ancient stone arch guard the entrance to a sort of clearing to the east. The arch is constructed of dark stone, carved into large square blocks. Wild roses, the color of deep crimson, wind their away up each side of the arch. Their fresh blossoms open outwards, letting loose with a perfume like fragrance. Below the thick cords of thorned vines, runes are visible, etched into the stone centuries ago.

rooms.name: Heart of the Vale
rooms.description: Home to the council of druids, the vale's heart has been designed by nature and her guardians.  Proud oaks dot the clearing, providing shelter with their massive canopies of leaves.  Around the oaks, lush grass and exotic flowering plants are visible.  Foilage fills in most of the remaining space, creating a natural barrier around the area.  A stone column is visisble in each of the clearing's four corners, each column standing over ten feet tall.  These monoliths stand defiantly against time itself, their weathered appearance several centuries old.

rooms.description: Home to the council of druids, the vale's heart has been designed by nature and her guardians. A slab of stone sits in the very center of this clearing, tilted upwards so its surface can be read.

rooms.name: Heart of the Vale
rooms.description: Home to the council of druids, the vale's heart has been designed by nature and her guardians.  Proud oaks dot the clearing, providing shelter with their massive canopies of leaves.  Around the oaks, lush grass and exotic flowering plants are visible.  Foilage fills in most of the remaining space, creating a natural barrier around the area.  A stone column is visisble in each of the clearing's four corners, each column standing over ten feet tall.  These monoliths stand defiantly against time itself, their weathered appearance several centuries old.

rooms.name: An Arched Gateway Entwined With Roses
rooms.description: &0   The curved remains of an ancient stone arch guard the entrance to a sort of clearing to the west. The arch is constructed of dark stone, carved into large square blocks. Wild roses, the color of deep crimson, wind their away up each side of the arch. Their fresh blossoms open outwards, letting loose with a perfume like fragrance. Below the thick cords of thorned vines, runes are visible, etched into the stone centuries ago.

rooms.name: Vale of Anlun
rooms.description: Thick foilage leaps up from the fertile earth of this lush valley, creating a dark green blanket of life over the whole area.  Plants spanning a thousand different species flourish here, cared for by the mystical powers of the druids and their goddess.  Huge oaks spring up in every corner, throwing out their huge canopies of healthy leaves to blanket the sky.  Just off to the west, several strange monoliths are detectable through the plantlife.

rooms.name: An Arched Gateway Entwined With Roses
rooms.description: &0   The curved remains of an ancient stone arch guard the entrance to a sort of clearing to the south. The arch is constructed of dark stone, carved into large square blocks. The vale exits into a deep forest to the north.

rooms.name: Deep Within the Forest
rooms.description: The sky rapidly disappears from view, replaced by the stretching branches of ancient trees.  Their healthy leaves blanket the area in shade, protecting against foul weather conditions.  Plants grow thickly between these massive giants, creating a hardy underbrush that stretches along the forest's floor. Flowers bloom brightly in every direction, poking up from beneath the curtain of ferns and other leafy plants.  Their sprinkling of color adds contrast to the lush green backdrop.  The forests seem full of webs to the west.

rooms.name: Nearing the Forest's Heart
rooms.description: The clinging plants of this region grow ever denser as the forest's center slowly approaches.  Proud trees stretch forth their branches, reaching upwards as far as the eye can see.  Most of the sky is gone, replaced by a cluttered canopy of green leaves.  To the east, a tall wall of thorned bushes is visible. They stand guard, refusing to let anyone any farther in that direction.

rooms.name: Along a Wall of Thorned Bushes
rooms.description: &0 The plant life here seems to have gone amuck.  A thick wall of bushes have sprouted up, encircling a massive section of the forest.  Their thick thorn-covered branches weave together to create a impenetrable wall of foliage. The rest of the forest is also quite dense in this region, with large clumps of trees and wide spread underbrush in every direction.  The sound of singing birds fill the air, as if they had nothing to do but create an endless chorus for all eternity.

rooms.name: A Dirt Trail Leading Into the Wailing Mountains
rooms.description: This dirt path breaks away from the main road and heads northwards, through the few remaining foothills of the Wailing Mountains and up towards its very edge.  The path is old, covered with layers of snow and ice patches.  The slick covering combined with the hardened dirt makes travel rough, as horses fall lame and wagon wheels snap.  For this reason, the path is seldom used.

rooms.name: A Dirt Trail Leading Into the Wailing Mountains
rooms.description: This dirt path breaks away from the main road and heads northwards, through the few remaining foothills of the Wailing Mountains and up towards its very edge.  The path is old, covered with layers of snow and ice patches.  The slick covering combined with the hardened dirt makes travel rough, as horses fall lame and wagon wheels snap.  For this reason, the path is seldom used.

rooms.name: Rocky Path in the Wailing Mountains
rooms.description: Cutting along the mountain range's edge, this path winds itself along the jagged rock.  Large stones and hundreds of pebbles lie strewn about, left from past avalanches.  The air is bitter cold, burning at exposed flesh with its icy touch.  Huge mounds of snow and ice line the path, creating dangerous patches that can easily spell death for the unwary.  The path itself slopes in a gradual upward direction, but turns and twists in several directions along the way.

rooms.name: A Gigantic Roc Nest
rooms.description: A huge mound of dried trees and foilage has been dragged up to this lonely section of the mountain path, creating a massive circular nest.  The nest is woven together firmly, allowing it to resist even the strongest of mountain storms.  A fine layer of soft fluff has been threaded throughout the upper layer of the nest, allowing the young to remain warm and comfortable while they grow.  Scattered bones of horses and humanoids lie strewn about, past meals for the babies and their parents.

rooms.name: Before an Ancient Cave
rooms.description: A small opening, perhaps six feet across, leads northward into the face of a rocky wall.  At first glance, it appears to be a natural structure.  Piled snow covers part of it, with a stunted mountain shrub sticking up from beneath the white mound.  Faint etchings line the cave's mouth however, drawn with such precision that they could not possibly be some fluke of nature.  It seems to be some sort of writing, but with origins that go beyond any known race.  The path contiues away from the cave to the east and west, winding back down the rocky mountainside.  It would also be possible to climb up over the cave mouth.

rooms.name: Inside a Sprawling Cavern
rooms.description: The cave opening leads into a natural cavern, its walls having been formed by erosion or perhaps an ancient earthquake.  The walls are rough, cracked with jagged protrusions jutting out at odd intervals.  As it leads farther back into the mountain, the cavern opens up even wider.  At the widest it is about two hundred feet across, with a vaulted ceiling about half that distance from the floor.  A chilling breeze blows in from the outside, gushing through the cavern and blowing back out through numerous tiny cracks that run along the walls and ceiling.  A long tunnel leads northward, deeper into the rocky surroundings. The Wailing Mountains are to the south.

rooms.name: A Rectangular Chamber
rooms.description: The rough walls of the cavern outside quickly disappear, replaced with the carefully carved outlines of smooth bricks.  The area here is rectangular in shape, stretching about a hundred feet long and perhaps fifty feet across.  It appears to be some sort of antechamber.  Ancient metallic fixtures shaped like grasping claws are positioned at even intervals about the room, offering a steady glow when each holds a torch.  The rest of the chamber is bare, save for the floor's center.  Carved upon the flat stone floor is a intricate mosaic depicting a vicious demonic figure facing off against a winged female.  In the very center floats an aquamarine stone that they seem to be fighting over.  In the background a terrible war between good and evil is taking place, with both sides losing heavily.  The rest of the room is oddly bare, without even the dust that would be expected in such an ancient place.

rooms.name: A Hidden Altar Room
rooms.description: A set of worn stone stairs leads from the antechamber above, spiraling down about ten feet to the inner chamber.  This room is crafted of carved bricks similiar to the ones above, each chiseled without a flaw.  Most are bare gray stone, but a few have been etched with odd shimmering runes.  Two braziers burn lowly near the northern wall, their golden flames emitting neither smoke nor odor.  They flank an impressive pedestal which stands about four feet high against the northern wall.  Runes of an unknown origin line the pedestal, creating a strange series of snakes that twist their way from top to bottom. The only exit is up the stairs.

rooms.name: Rocky Path in the Wailing Mountains
rooms.description: Cutting along the mountain range's edge, this path winds itself along the jagged rock.  Large stones and hundreds of pebbles lie strewn about, left from past avalanches. The path itself slopes in a gradual upward direction, but turns and twists in several directions along the way.

rooms.name: Along a Wall of Thorned Bushes
rooms.description: &0 The plant life here seems to have gone amuck.  A thick wall of bushes have sprouted up, encircling a massive section of the forest.  Their thick thorn-covered branches weave together to create a impenetrable wall of foliage. The rest of the forest is also quite dense in this region, with large clumps of trees and wide spread underbrush in every direction.  The sound of singing birds fill the air, as if they had nothing to do but create an endless chorus for all eternity.

rooms.name: Nearing the Forest's Heart
rooms.description: The clinging plants of this region grow ever denser, as the forest's center slowly approaches.  Proud trees stretch forth their branches, reaching upwards as far as the eye can see.  Most of the sky is gone, replaced by a cluttered canopy of green leaves.  To the west, a tall wall of thorned bushes is visible. They stand guard, refusing to let anyone any farther in that direction.

rooms.name: Deep Within the Forest
rooms.description: The sky rapidly disappears from view, replaced by the stretching branches of ancient trees.  Their healthy leaves blanket the area in shade, protecting against foul weather conditions.  Plants grow thickly between these massive giants, creating a hardy underbrush that stretches along the forest's floor. Flowers bloom brightly in every direction, poking up from beneath the curtain of ferns and other leafy plants.  Their sprinkling of color adds contrast to the lush green backdrop.

rooms.name: Hidden Niche Within the Thorned Bushes
rooms.description: Clinging branches armed with inch long thorns stab outwards at every angle, trying their best to protect this hidden passage from view.  Combined with the broad leaves from the bushes, this provides adaquate cover from the casual glance.  As the trail leads even deeper into the forest's heart, bits of old stone can be seen.  Some appear as nothing more then rocks, but others were obviously part of some larger construction.  Ancient runes, long since faded from comprehension, are now just barely visible on these stones.

rooms.name: Sparsely Wooded Clearing
rooms.description: The thick forest growth slowly breaks up, as the hidden passage opens onto a sort of clearing.  Several young trees dot the grassy clearing, adding patches of shade.  Many smaller plants grow along the clearing, but the larger bushes hold themselves at bay.  Several toppled columns are visible, scattered between the trees without a noticeable pattern.

rooms.name: Before a Collection of Ancient Druidic Stones
rooms.description: The wooded clearing finally comes to an end here at the forest's very center.  Ancient oak trees line the heart, their bulky branches sprawling out to cover the sky.  Dotted between these impressive trees, a collection of standing stones can be seen.  Each is about eight feet tall, covered from top to bottom with druidic symbols.  This is surely one of the power points of nature.

rooms.name: Deserted Path Within the Wooded Foothills
rooms.description: Deeper within the forest, it slowly begins to thin, opening up onto a faded overgrown path.  Looming trees leap up on eitheer side of the path, casting their shade and blocking out most of the sky.  The ground here is rough and sloping, much like most of the other hills in this region.  Cracked rocks and old stones line the path, as if some ancient ruins once existed in this forest. The road is to the west and another path leads east into the forest.

rooms.name: Deserted Path Within the Wooded Foothills

Cracked rocks and old stones line the path, as if some ancient ruins once existed in this forest. The road is to the west and another path leads east into the forest.

rooms.name: Overgrown Trail Deep Within the Forest
rooms.description: The trees once again begin to crowd the faded path, leaving little of it in view at times.  Thick gnarled vines snake their way across the path, dangling down from trees and across scattered boulders.  The amount of loose rock slowly begins to increase, with more crumbling debris coming into view.  Far off to the east, an unfamiliar mountain range is just visible through the thick canopy.  The path splits off here, leading north, south, and west.

rooms.name: A Circle of Standing Stones
rooms.description: &0 The forest breaks apart, revealing a wide clearing of sorts on a sloping hillside.  At least a half dozen stone columns have ben arranged on the hill's crest in a semi-circle, surrounding an ancient oak tree.  Ancient writing covers most of these stones, etched into their rough surfaces several hundred years ago.  It is apparent this place is important to the druids.  Perhaps it is some point of power for communing with nature.

rooms.name: Elevated Ledge Above a Crystalline Pool
rooms.description: A faded dirt path cuts its way through the thinning tangle of trees on either side, slowly sloping downwards towards the south.  Through the slender trunks of the trees, a pool of flowing water is visible.  Its surface is rough, in constant movement, as if some underwater current ran through it.  Not much can be seen by the pool's shore, but the slope leading down to its edge from this position is too rough and overgrown to traverse.  A few scattered stones lie strewn about the path, but for the most part it is clear from debris.

rooms.description: A faded dirt path cuts its way through the thinning tangle of trees on either side, slowly sloping downwards towards the west.  Through the slender trunks of the trees, a pool of flowing water is visible.  Its surface is rough, in constant movement, as if some underwater current ran through it.  Not much can be seen by the pool's shore, but the slope leading down to its edge from this position is too rough and overgrown to traverse.  A few scattered stones lie strewn about the path, but for the most part it is clear from debris.

rooms.name: Shore of the Crystalline Pool
rooms.description: The sloped path finally levels off, coming to an end before a wide dirt clearing.  The thick walls of trees can be seen on either side, circling the pool as they crowd in for a drink of frsh water.  A soft sound of bubbling water fills the air, like music probably coming from a hidden waterfall.  An assortment of lush plants grow along the lake's edge, adding to the enviroment's serenity.

rooms.name: On a Crystalline Pool
rooms.description: A calm flowing pool of water lies nestled within a niche of this forest. On either side a steep sloping bath is visible, leading northward back towards the forest's heart.  Plants grow everywhere, sprouting up from the moist soil whenever space permits.  Snaking vines, thorny bushes, and even mighty trees prosper on the shores of this sweet smelling pool.  Its cool waters appear to be quite deep, but clear and clean.

rooms.name: A Circle of Ancient Stone Monoliths
rooms.description: The forest opens up upon a small clearing, complete with a clear pool of fresh water and several trimmed hedges.  Bushes and flowers of a wide variety prosper here, probably due to the odd lack of coldness that usually plagues the south.  A collection of proud standing stones encircles the pool, each at least twelve feet tall.  Probably druidic in nature, these ancient monoliths could have stood here for centuries.  This is obviously a place of great importance to these druids.

rooms.name: Overgrown Remains of a Stone Monolith
rooms.description: The forest grows thick here, blanketing everything within its hold of green life.  Plants of all sorts sprout of from the rich soil, spurred to life by the wonders of nature.  Buried deep within the underbrush, a collection of large stone chunks are visible.  They seem to have once belonged to an ancient column or monolith.  Several more of these monoliths are visible, still intact standing amongst the trees with an equal splendor.  Vines crawl up their sides, providing protection from the casual search.  This appears to be some sort of ancient power point, used to commune with nature by the druids.

rooms.name: Main Road along the Western Coast
rooms.description: This road cuts its way across the realms, heading northward and southward along the western coast.  Salt tainted winds blow in from the sea to the west, carrying with them the scent of wide open waters and countless fish.  The distant sounds of dancing waves and squawking seabirds fill the air, creating a serene traveling song.  Thick blue grass lines the road sides, blowing in the wind in a similiar fashion to the distant waves.

rooms.name: Western Coastal Road Through the Rolling Hills
rooms.description: The scene to the west remains virtually unchanged, with the occasional sand beach dotting the endless western coastline.  The waves are perhaps a bit rougher, a foot or two higher when compared to the milder weather to the north. To the east, the plains are slowly transforming into rolling hills.  The once flat surface is sloping up and down, becoming rougher as the terrain sweeps ever northwards to the unseen peeks of the Wailing Mountains.  The road presses ever onwards, cutting through the terrain sparing little attention for the changing environment.

rooms.name: Western Coastal Road Through the Rolling Hills
rooms.description: The waves of the ocean lap gently at the sandy beaches of the western coastline.  To the east, a road cuts westward from the plains and the rolling hills to form an intersection here.  Far off to the southeast, the white-tipped peaks of the Mountains of Pain stand like a jagged line of sentinels.  The coastal road continues unabated, running north-south along the coastline.

rooms.name: Western Coastal Road Through the Rolling Hills
rooms.description: The scene to the west remains virtually unchanged, with the occasional sand beach dotting the endless western coastline. rooms.name: Split in the Western Coastal Road
rooms.description: As the Ulgranian peninsula juts out into the sea, the western coastal road momentarily leaves the water's side to cut across the land formation.  A simple dirt road breaks off and heads westward, out towards the very tip of the peninsula and to the town of Solta which can be located there.  To the north and south, the road once again meets up with the coast.

rooms.name: Dirt Road Leading Across the Ulgranian Peninsula
rooms.description: The little port town of Solta can be seen far to the west, at the peninsula's point.  Its walls are fortified to protect it against the vile orc hoards and northern bandits that hunt this area.  Although rather small, Solta is an important port town.  It provides safe haven to the massive ships from Lyania when a vicious storm hits the area and is often visited by several exotic merchant ships.

rooms.name: Down a Slippery Slope
rooms.description: Descending into a verdant vale, this path would hardly be more than a deer track were it not lined with stones of all colors and sizes.  Some of the stones are marked with faded runes of harmony with nature, and many are covered with a thick green moss.  The path rises to the south and descends to the north.

rooms.name: Down a Slippery Slope
rooms.description: Descending into a verdant vale, this path would hardly be more than a deer track were it not lined with stones of all colors and sizes.  Some of the stones are marked with faded runes of harmony with nature, and many are covered with a thick green moss.  Sounds of birdcalls and the voices of animals echo, but they are nowhere to be seen.  The path rises to the west and descends to the north.

rooms.name: A Ridge in the Forest
rooms.description: Far to the west, the black spire of Mount Nukreth is visible through the trees.  Here on the ridge, a chill wind blows in from the Wailing Mountains far to the north, bringing the smell of snow to this lush forest.  The green stretches out below the ridge, but up ehre only a few hardy pines grow.  A light trail, hardly more than a deer track, runs from the south and then turns east to descend the ridge.

rooms.name: A Ridge in the Forest

rooms.name: Ascent in the Forest
rooms.description: A faint path leads away from the forest sprites' dwelling and east into the verdant woods, ascending a hill that slowly rises above the surrounding land. The path is hardly visible beneath the ground cover, but it has been marked with moss-covered stones of all sizes and varieties.  The smell of growing plants is overpowering, but sound is muffled and does not travel far.

rooms.name: Western Coastal Road Cutting Across the Rugged Lands
rooms.description: As the Wailing Mountains barely become visible along the northern horizon, the gently rolling hills begin to become more defined.  The lush green grasses and sparse trees are slowly relpaced by the half-brown northland grass and stunted foilage.  The weather becomes a bit colder, as freezing winds blow down the very distant mountainside and roll across these rugged hills.  The road continues on its determined path north and southward, running through whatever stands in its path.

rooms.name: Western Coastal Road Along Mount Nukreth's Base
rooms.description: Like a decaying fang of some vicious beast, Mount Nukreth juts upwards from within the surrounding hills.  This lone peak looks oddly out of place, having been formed from an unnatural-looking black rock.  Its base stretches on in all dirctions and comes to rest about ten yards from the road's edge.  The peak's very tip is hidden from view, though the sloping sides easily reach over a thousand feet into the air.  Stunted black trees grow along Mount Nukreth, the only living things that dare to come anywhere near its corrupted form.

The lush green grasses and sparse trees are slowly relpaced by the half-brown northland grass and stunted foilage.  The weather becomes a bit colder, as freezing winds blow down the very distant mountainside and roll across these rugged hills.  The road continues on its determined path north and southward, running through whatever stands in its path.

rooms.name: Dirt Road Through the Eastern Plains
rooms.description: A well-maintained road showing signs of heavy usage, this trail leads from Toldar's Keep in the north and curves around to meet Lake Fedis in the east. Favored over the harsher conditions of the caravan route through the Wailing Mountains by larger parties and kept safe by the soldiers of the borderhold, it is nonetheless vulnerable to attack by roving bands of barbarians, bandits and orcs because of the rich temptation of a fat merchant caravan.  The Wailing Mountains lie to the north, and another, unnamed mountain range can barely be seen far to the south.

rooms.name: Junction of Roads
rooms.description: The western coastal road finally comes to an end here, as it turns sharply to the east and becomes more of a caravan route.  The giant range of peaks known as the Wailing Mountains block any further passage to the north, their dark looming height far too dangerous to be conquered by even the most brave of travelers.  Despite this, it looks like an entrance has been carved into the mountainside.  The carvan route leads far off to the east, heading along the Wailing Mountains and their foothills, while the coastal road leads south.

North.description: A large archway leads into an inviting, stone structure.

rooms.name: Caravan Route Along the Wailing Mountains
rooms.description: This winding road runs along the base of the Wailing Mountains, cutting through the jagged foothills to create a rather solid road to travel upon. Mounds of snow and ice cover the mountain sides, sweeping down in sections to overun part of the caravan route.  The occasional twisted pine can be seen on the horizon, a lone sliver of life amongst the cold browns and whites.  A low, constant wailing can be heard at all hours as wind blows through the cave-ridden mountain peaks.

rooms.name: Overgrown Road Through the Grasslands
rooms.description: Tall, seeded grasses sway in the constant wind from the Wailing Mountains to the north as Nature threatens to obliterate this ancient road.  Broken stones outline a path over the even ground, marked with runes and strange symbols whose meaning have been forgotten long ago.  Though once a major trading route, it looks like this road doesn't get much traffic nowadays.  The road stretches out to the east, and a forest rises to the west.

rooms.name: Caravan Route Through a Copse of Pine Trees
rooms.description: The sudden appearance of trees is quite a change from the cold brown and white hills that dominate this area.  The tall dark forms of ancient pines leap up from the rough ground, their thick trunks mere feet apart as if they crowd together for warmth.  The caravan road leads right through this densly populated forest.  Ancient tree stumps line the road, the work of barbarian woodsmen.

rooms.name: Near a Fortified Borderhold
rooms.description: The hills flatten out a bit here, coming upon a small valley leading down to the eastern plains.  Winding out of the foothills, the caravan route runs right up to the west gate of a military stronghold to the east.  Its high stone walls are decorated with minor damage, trophies of their previous battles.  The keep guards the caravan route, protecting it from marauders prowling its length. To the north, the Wailing Mountains rise into the clouds, their chilly peaks accessible through a pass somewhere to the east.  Plains lie to the south, and a road can be seen running through them to the southeast.

rooms.name: Before the Borderhold's Western Gates
rooms.description: The west gate of the borderhold looks somewhat newer than the knicked gray stone walls stretching out on either side of its reinforced iron doors. Standing several lengths higher than the walls on either side of the gate, the steel-barred doors are cast from massive single pieces of iron.  They swing outwards on strong reinforced hinges capable of holding the strongest battering ram at bay.  A small wooden shack sits just to the side of the dirt caravan route that stretches off into the distance to the west.

rooms.name: Before the Borderhold's Eastern Gates
rooms.description: The caravan route comes to an abrupt end here, running right up to the huge iron gates of the borderhold.  Still keeping some of their original casting's shine, the gates look somewhat newer than the drab gray stone walls running out on either side of the gates.  Massive bars of steel reinforce the gates, locked into ponderous steel hinges running up and down each side of the gate.  The ground to the north is quite rocky, approaching the base of the Wailing Mountains.

rooms.name: Path Near a Fortified Borderhold
rooms.description: The hills flatten out a bit here, coming upon a small valley leading down to the eastern plains.  Winding out of the foothills, the caravan route nears the high stone walls of a borderhold to the west.  The keep right across the road, its gates guarding passage through.  To the north, the Wailing Mountains rise into the clouds, their chilly peaks accessible through a pass somewhere to the west.  Plains lie to the south, and a road can be seen running through them to the southwest.

rooms.name: Caravan Route Along the Wailing Mountains
rooms.description: This winding road runs along the base of the Wailing Mountains, cutting through the jagged foothills to create a rather solid road to travel upon. Mounds of snow and ice cover the mountain sides, sweeping down in sections to overun part of the caravan route.  The occasional twisted pine can be seen on the horizon, a lone sliver of life amongst the cold browns and whites.  A low, constant wailing can be heard at all hours as wind blows through the cave-ridden mountain peaks.

rooms.name: Copse of Pine Trees
rooms.description: Tall pine trees line this whole hillside, their thick stubborn roots having long since burrowed their way into the rocky ground.  A thick canopy of stretching tree limbs cover everything overhead, blocking out some of the more foul weather.  A dry blanket of fallen needles covers the ground, creating loud snapping sounds whenever someone walks though them.  The scent of pine dominates the chilled air, muffling all other smells in the area.

The scent of pine dominates the chilled air, muffling all other smells in the area.  To the south, it seems like a better variety of trees is growing.

rooms.name: Fangron Forest
rooms.description: The forest starts to thicken just off the eastern side of the road, and grows even denser at it travels eastward.  Thorny bushes line the narrow dirt trail that leads between the trees, forcing all but the most enduring of wanders to stay upon the set course.  Oddly enough, no birds can be heard singing within the trees, and no squirrels leap from branch to branch.  There appears to be no sound of life at all, except for the occasional rustle of some far off branch.  Few people are foolish enough to travel within Fangron Forest, avoiding its wicked depths at all costs.

rooms.name: Webbed Section of Fangron Forest
rooms.description: Shadows creep their way along the forest, as the trees grow closer together and weave their branches into a thick canopy above.  The ground has little vegetation, save for the occasional patch of moss or even fern that absorbs what little sunlight it can get.  Thick strands of webbing cover most of the surrounding plant life, laid down by some monstrous spider.  Some have been strung between branches to trap unwary travelers as they walk the paths. Other webs just lie across the ground to trap creatures that step upon them. The webs create a ghost-like mist over the area, adding to the eerie surroundings.

rooms.description: Shadows creep their way along the forest, as the trees grow closer together and weave their branches into a thick canopy above.  The ground has little vegetation, save for the occasional patch of moss or even fern that absorbs what little sunlight it can get.  Thick strands of webbing cover most of the surrounding plant life, laid down by some monstrous spider.  Some have been strung between branches to trap unwary travelers as they walk the paths. Other webs just lie across the ground to trap creatures that step upon them. The webs create a ghost-like mist over the area, adding to the eerie surroundings.  The forest seems to clear up to the east.

rooms.name: Below a Twisted Tree Trunk
rooms.description: The thick forest clears a bit, creating a small field about twenty paces across.  In the very center of this clearing, a fat twisted tree stretches upwards to mingle its thick collection of branches with the other trees high above in the canopy.  Webbing covers most of the clearing, stringing its way up the trunk as well.  The thick white substance is much like the webs left by spiders, but the amount present would take millions of tiny spiders to create.

rooms.name: Fangron Forest
rooms.description: The forest starts to thicken just off the eastern side of the road, and grows even denser at it travels eastward.  Thorny bushes line the narrow dirt trail that leads between the trees, forcing all but the most enduring of wanders to stay upon the set course.  Oddly enough, no birds can be heard singing within the trees, and no squirrels leap from branch to branch.  There appears to be no sound of life at all, except for the occasional rustle of some far off branch.  Few people are foolish enough to travel within Fangron Forest, avoiding its wicked depths at all costs.

rooms.name: Into the Thick Canopy
rooms.description: Several thick strands of webbing, and the odd angular shape of the nearby trunks make it easy to ascend into the tree tops from this point.  Thick bunches of leaves hang down from above, blanketing everything with their lush green life.  Webs also are visible, strung up from every available branch.  The trunk continues upwards, into the canopy above.

rooms.name: Forest Canopy Strung with Thick Webs
rooms.description: Webs line this whole area, hanging from branches at every angle.  They drape downwards to create vicious nets that could ensnare something the size of a horse with little problem.  Vast lines of cocoons hang from these webs, some of which still twitch with a living being inside.  However, most contain empty husks, long since drained of all their life fluids.  This massive collection of webs leads off along the canopy.

rooms.name: Winding Path Down to a Gravel Beach
rooms.description: &0   A small dirt path branches off from the main road, and heads towards the gravel path to the west. It slopes downwards, as it makes a trail across a steep hill. A few weeds grow along the path, mostly an odd variety of brown grass that can survive the harsh northern weather. Farther to the west, a sweeping gravel beach can be seen spreading itself out along the coastline.

rooms.name: A Gravel Beach
rooms.description: The wide gravel beach spreads over most of this area, its surface covered with a thick layer of stones broken down from the nearby hills and cliffs. These rocks are mostly gray in color, sharp and uncomfortable to walk on.  A few, however, gleam with an assortment of ores and bits of worthless metal that create a nice luster.  The sea to the west is rough, with huge waves crashing at random intervals against the stone beach.  A cold breeze is almost constantly blowing in from the water, carrying with it the scent of salt and the sound of seabirds.  Far to the north, a series of cliffs are visible.

rooms.name: Gravel Beach Leading Towards the Cliffs
rooms.description: The sheer rock face of a massive cliff blocks towers just to the east of this beach section.  Massive waves have pounded against its rough surface for ages, creating countless indentations and small caves.  The gravel beach leads along this cliff, heading northward to come to face a rocky wall.  Crashing water stretches off to the west as far as the eye can see, its deep blue coloring similiar to that of a storm-ridden night.  The beach continues off to the south, spreading out to almost thirty feet across.

rooms.name: Dark Cave Entrance in the Cliff Face
rooms.description: The rocky beach leads right up to this cliff face, coming to an end before the blackish stone wall.  Its rough surface is soaked from the misty spray that is created by the nearby waves crashing against rocky pillars.  A gaping hole has been formed near the center of this cliff wall, its blackened entrance almost invisible behind cone-like rocks that jab upwards from the gravel beach.

rooms.name: A Narrow Tunnel in the Rocky Cliff
rooms.description: This narrow tunnel is barely six feet across, its rough stone walls hinting at its natural origin.  Most likely formed by the nearby waves crashing against the cliff, the cave must have existed here for centuries.  The dark walls are moist with salt water, splashed in during one of the more violent storms.  A tunnel leads off to the east, deeper into the cliff.

rooms.name: A Narrow Tunnel in the Rocky Cliff
rooms.description: This narrow tunnel is barely six feet across, its rough stone walls hinting at its natural origin.  Most likely formed by the nearby waves crashing against the cliff, the cave must have existed here for centuries.  The dark walls are moist with salt water, splashed in during one of the more violent storms.  A tunnel leads off to the east, deeper into the cliff.

rooms.name: A Cavern of Stygian Mosaics
rooms.description: Mosaics from a countless number of dark religions line the walls of this cavern, their art sweeping from one end to the other in an endless scene of darkness. Vile demons and devils are portrayed committing profane acts upon the forces of good and evil alike. Flashing claws tear into exposed flesh, stinging fangs biting into the defenseless. There are drawings on the uneven rock wall.  Most seem to have been drawn with dyes, chalk, and paint, but a few have been etched in blood, probably the life fluids of some innocent victim fallen to the monstrosities that created this hellish art.

rooms.name: Before an Unholy Bonfire
rooms.description: Snaking tendrils of sapphire flame lick up from the bonfire built into the cavern's center.  The tendrils twirl and dance, spurred on by some unseen force.  Puffs of black smoke leak from the unholy flame, carrying with it the odor of scorched flesh and exotic herbs.  The smoke curls up towards the ceiling, only to be quickly engulfed by a passing breeze.  A few chunks of driftwood are visible within the blue and black flames, but the main fuel seems to be the severed limbs of some unfortunate humanoid.  Several scattered bones, scorched black from heat, lie nearby in a heap, past victims of this corrupted fire.  The cavern can be seen in all directions, illuminated with bizarre shadows from the raging bonfire.

rooms.name: A Bloodied Shrine
rooms.description: This fallen shrine has been devoted to the fallen gods, the unholy entities of chaos.  Foul symbols of this perverse religion hang from the cavern walls between painted images of the dark gods and their servitors.  The altar itself is crafted from stone and a black metal.  It is covered with dried chipping blood, remains from the last victim of the cult that dwells nearby.
